adjectives.description: vapory (comparative more vapory, superlative most vapory)

examples: But here again, Christians consider the word literally, as though the Lord would appear upon the vapory clouds over our heads.

entries.meaning: Characterized by the presence of vapor; full of, or obscured by, vapor.
examples: The most fetid and poisonous smells everywhere prevailed; and by the aid of that ghastly light which, even at midnight, never fails to emanate from a vapory and pestilential atmosphere, might be discerned lying in the by-paths and alleys, or rotting in the windowless habitations, the carcass of many a nocturnal plunderer arrested by the hand of the plague in the very perpetration of his robbery.
